title: Correlation
text: attempt link similar features basis correlation. TangledFeatures automatically detects type correlation needed two features. currently generate correlations numeric, unordered categorical variables ordered categorical variables can set correlation type based upon data set within package. can also generate correlation heat map entire data set well interconnected network graph

title: Correlation
text: Numeric--Numeric Correlation: Set cor1 metric. Currently defaults Pearson correlation Numeric--Factor(Unordered): Set cor2 metric. Currently defaults PointBiserial correlation Numeric--Factor(Ordered): Set cor3 metric. Currently defaults Kendall correlation Factor(Unordered)--Factor(Ordered) Set cor3 metric. Currently defaults chi Squared test Factor(Unordered)--Factor(Unordered) Set cor3 metric. Currently defaults Cramer’s V Factor(Ordered)--Factor(Ordered) Set cor3 metric. Currently defaults Polychoric correlation

title: Correlation
text: Set plot = TRUE initial function can generate heat map final TangledFeatures object can generate interconnected graph well
code: plot_obj <- TangledFeatures(Data)$Correlation_heatmap plot(plot_obj) plot_obj <- TangledFeatures(Data)$Graph_plot plot(plot_obj)

title: Example_Walkthrough
text: able identify variable class variable assign ’s appropriate correlation relationship variables. Read Correlation section. data_clean set ‘TRUE’ follow set steps clean data including cleaning column names, dummy column creation removal NAs. Please read ‘Data_input’ section. Let’s set function call ’s various outputs function returns visualizations metrics correlation well interesting metrics  visualization purposes, working top 20 variables. can see can take various relationships visualize single graph. TangledFeatures also returns variables well correlation metric used .  can see graph, using graph theory algorithms can trace interrelationships variables. two distinct groups can see effect sales price. can take single variable group group representative.
code: Results <- TangledFeatures::TangledFeatures(Data = TangledFeatures::Housing_Prices_dataset, Y_var = 'SalePrice', Focus_variables = list(), corr_cutoff = 0.7, RF_coverage = 0.95, num_features = 5,  plot = TRUE, fast_calculation = FALSE, cor1 = 'pearson', cor2 = 'polychoric', cor3 = 'spearman') #> Warning: as(<nsCMatrix>, "lsCMatrix") is deprecated since Matrix 1.5-0; do #> as(., "lMatrix") instead Heatmap_plot <- Results$Correlation_heatmap plot(Heatmap_plot) Igraph_plot <- Results$Graph_plot plot(Igraph_plot)

what: Feature Selection in highly correlated space
title: Feature Selection in highly correlated space
text: TangledFeatures feature selection method extracts needed variables highly interrelated spaces. alter nature variables hence alternative traditional dimensionality reduction techniques. Features extracted meant inputted easily explainable models linear/logistic regressions shallow decision trees. TangledFeatures attempts provide highly accurate interpretable models opposed current black box solutions.

title: Feature Selection in highly correlated space
text: can install development version TangledFeatures like :

title: Feature Selection in highly correlated space
code: Result = TangledFeatures(Data, Y_var, Focus_variables = list(), corr_cutoff = 0.7, RF_coverage = 0.95, num_features = 5,  plot = FALSE, fast_calculation = FALSE, cor1 = 'pearson', cor2 = 'PointBiserial', cor3 = 'cramersV')

title: Feature Selection in highly correlated space
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(TangledFeatures) ## basic example code  Result = TangledFeatures(Data, Y_var, Focus_variables = list(), corr_cutoff = 0.7, RF_coverage = 0.95, num_features = 5,  plot = FALSE, fast_calculation = FALSE, cor1 = 'pearson', cor2 = 'PointBiserial', cor3 = 'cramersV')  Variables <- Result$Groups

title: The main TangledFeatures function — TangledFeatures
text: Data imported Data Frame Y_var dependent variable Focus_variables list variables wish give certain bias correlation matrix corr_cutoff correlation cutoff variable. Defaults 0.8 RF_coverage Random Forest coverage explainable. Defaults 95 percent num_features number features returned within random forest plot Return plotting done. Binary True False fast_calculation Returns variable list without many Random Forest iterations simply picking variable correlated group cor1 correlation metric two continuous features. Defaults pearson correlation cor2 correlation metric one categorical feature one continuous feature. Defaults bi serial correlation correlation cor3 correlation metric two categorical features. Defaults CramersV correlation

title: The main TangledFeatures function — TangledFeatures
text: Returns list variables ready future modelling
